reference.title: Stage 3 proposal: Feature 13086
reference.shortdesc: Proposal to add a new element to support a troubleshooting statement after the <stepresult> element in a <step> element in a task topic.

strow.stentry: Thilo Buchholtz, Stan Doherty, Kris Eberlein, JoAnn Hackos, Eliot Kimber

section.title: Approved technical requirements
section.p: Add troubleshooting element to a step: There is often a need to include a troubleshooting statement in a task step, following the <stepresult> element. The purpose of this "trouble" statement is to help the reader resolve any problems that may arise should their step result not match the result stated in the <stepresult> section of the step.

section.title: Use cases
section.p: There is often a need to include a troubleshooting statement in a task step, following the <stepresult> element. The purpose of this "trouble" statement is to help the reader resolve any problems that may arise should their step result not match the result stated in the <stepresult> section of the step. This use case helps the reader resolve a problem encountered while performing a specific step.

ul.li: This addition will benefit writers who want to provide important troubleshooting information within a step right that the point of need by the users
This enhancement will have a significant impact because key troubleshooting information will be called out and not be missed by users
Many people will probably benefit from this feature
This feature’s utility will be comparable to that realized by the other semantic sub-elements available under step

section.title: Dependencies or interrelated proposals
section.p: This change to <step> does not depend on, or interact with, any other submitted proposals. However, three other proposals relating to troubleshooting semantics are also being considered. The Technical Communication Subcommittee will provide the text explaining the interrelationships of these elements and attributes with the set of three proposals.

dlentry.dd: Add an attribute value to the <note> element's type attribute to distinguish troubleshooting information. Status: phase 3

section.title: Modified DTDs
section.p: A new element named <steptroubleshooting> will follow the %lt;stepresult> element as the optional last child of the <step> element. The <steptroubleshooting> element will not be availble in any other context. For example, the <steptroubleshooting> will not be available in the <substep> element or in the <stepxmp> element. The only DTD file affected is dtd.mod under technicalContent/dtd.
See Modifications to task.mod for all necessary DTD changes.
